de.nec.nle.siafu.utils
Class PersistentCachedMap

java.lang.Object
  de.nec.nle.siafu.utils.PersistentCachedMap
Direct Known Subclasses:
SiafuGradientCache
public class PersistentCachedMap
extends Object

An implementation of the Map interface which also provides persistance and handling of big amounts of memory. When new object is added, it is persisted into path/mapName, where path defaults to $user.home/.PersistentCachedMaps/ . This implementation does not support null keys or values, nor duplicate keys. The cacheSize parameter defines how many elements the map will keep in cached memory.

Author:
Miquel Martin

Constant Field Values

cacheSize

protected int cacheSize
The size of the cache. Note that if you make this too big, you will run out of heap space.

path

protected String path
The path in which to store the persisted elements.

Constructor Detail

PersistentCachedMap

public PersistentCachedMap(String name,
                           int cacheSize,
                           boolean fillCache)
Creates a new map, assuming that the base path is "user.home/.PersistentCachedMaps/name".

Parameters:
name - the name of the map
cacheSize - the amount of maps to keep in memory at any time. When this number is reached, the next loaded map will force the oldest one in memory to be removed, becoming only accessible through hard drive read
fillCache - whether you would like to read the first cacheSize elements from the hard drive and put them in the cache.

PersistentCachedMap

public PersistentCachedMap(String basePath,
                           String name,
                           int cacheSize,
                           boolean fillCache)
Creatres a new Map. Cachesize elements will be kept on memory. The persisted elements are stored, one file per value.
The folder where the maps are stored is "basePath/name"

Parameters:
basePath - the directory that contains all of the persisted maps
name - the name of the map.
cacheSize - the amount of maps to keep in memory at any time. When this number is reached, the next loaded map will force the oldest one in memory to be removed, becoming only accessible through hard drive read.
fillCache - whether you would like to read the first cacheSize elements from the hard drive and put them in the cache.
Method Detail

fillCache

public void fillCache(int desiredCacheSize)
Load the first desiredCacheSize persisted elements to memory for faster access.

Parameters:
desiredCacheSize - the number of elements to read

put

public Object put(Object key,
                  Object value)
Put a new mapping into the PersistendCachedMap. Note that, unlike the put method in the Map interface, we don't return the oldvalue of the object if it alrady existed. Instead, it only returns null, since when adding big collections, getting the persisted data becomes too slow.

Parameters:
key - the key to put
value - the value for that key
Returns:
Always null. This is inconsistent with the Map interface.

get

public Object get(String key)
Get the value mapped to the key given in o.

Parameters:
o - the key
Returns:
the mapped value

remove

public Object remove(Object o)
Remove a mapping from the persisted cached map.

Parameters:
o - the key for the mapping that has to be removed
Returns:
the old value of the mapping, before it was removed

                             Object value)

public int size()

the size of the map

Returns:
the key set

values

public Collection<Object> values()
We do not support retrieveing all the values of the map, since it beats the purpose of persisting them, and is likely to cause an out of memory error.

Returns:
nothing
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException

Returns:
true if the key is mapped

containsValue

public boolean containsValue(Object value)
We do not support checking all the values of the map, since it beats the purpose of persisting them, and is likely to cause an out of memory error.

Parameters:
value - the value to check
Returns:
nothing
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException
